content: Act as a helpful AI assistant

In Julia, Given a DataFrame `df` with column `dt` representing DateTimes. Write a function `add_yearmonth` that creates a new column `ym` by extracting year and month from `dt` and concatenating them together as an integer in format: “yyyymm”.

You can achieve this by creating a new column `ym` in the DataFrame `df` by extracting the year and month from the DateTime in column `dt`. Here is an example function `add_yearmonth` that accomplishes this:

```julia
using DataFrames

function add_yearmonth(df::DataFrame)
    df.ym = Date.(df.dt).year .* 100 .+ Date.(df.dt).month
    return df
end
```

You can call this function with your DataFrame `df` to add the new column `ym` containing the year and month concatenated together as an integer in the format "yyyymm".
